_comment: This is an example configuration file for setting up a demo ecosystem in Upsun. Copy this file and modify the values below to match your company and requirements.

company._comment: Company information - customize these values for your demo
company.name: TechStart Solutions

organizations._comment: Organizations are billing entities in Upsun. Fixed orgs are better for monolithic apps (CMS, e-commerce), Flex orgs for microservices and custom apps.

fixed._comment: Fixed organizations - use for monolithic applications like CMS, e-commerce sites
fixed.name: TechStart Solutions
fixed.label: TechStart Solutions

flex._comment: Flex organizations - use for microservices and custom applications with granular resource control
flex.name: TechStart Labs
flex.label: TechStart Labs

teams._comment: Teams group users with specific roles and access. Customize team names and descriptions for your organization.
teams.name: dev-team
teams.title: Development Team

users._comment: Users with access to the ecosystem. Roles: admin (full access), contributor (project access), viewer (read-only). Update emails, names, and team assignments.
users.title: CEO

projects._comment: Projects are applications hosted within organizations. Each project needs a unique name, title, and organization assignment.
projects.name: techstart-website
projects.title: TechStart Website

source._comment: Source configuration: 'local' for local directories, 'github' for GitHub repositories

domains._comment: Custom domains for each environment. Update with your actual domains.

environment_variables._comment: Environment variables for all projects. Global variables apply to all environments, environment-specific variables override global ones.

global._comment: Global variables applied to all projects and environments

integrations._comment: Third-party integrations for monitoring, logging, and source control

_usage_notes._comment: How to use this configuration file:
_usage_notes.1: Copy this file to 'demo-config.json' and modify the values above
_usage_notes.2: Update company information, organization names, and user details
_usage_notes.3: Configure projects with either 'local' or 'github' sources
_usage_notes.4: Set appropriate domains for each environment
_usage_notes.5: Adjust resource allocations based on your needs
_usage_notes.6: Run 'python demo-setup.py' to generate setup scripts
_usage_notes.7: Execute the generated scripts to create your demo ecosystem
_usage_notes.8: Use cleanup scripts to remove the demo when finished
